properties.name: camel.component.mllp.accept-timeout
properties.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) while waiting for a TCP connection TCP Server Only

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.auto-ack
properties.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of a MLLP Acknowledgement MLLP Consumers only

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.backlog
properties.description: The maximum queue length for incoming connection indications (a request to connect) is set to the backlog parameter. If a connection indication arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.bind-retry-interval
properties.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to wait between bind attempts

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.bind-timeout
properties.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to retry binding to a server port

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to receive incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. If disabled, the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions by logging them at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.charset-name
properties.description: Sets the default charset to use

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.configuration
properties.description: Sets the default configuration to use when creating MLLP endpoints. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.mllp.MllpConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.connect-timeout
properties.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) for establishing for a TCP connection TCP Client only

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.default-charset
properties.description: Set the default character set to use for byte to/from String conversions.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the mllp component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.exchange-pattern
properties.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.hl7-headers
properties.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of message headers from the HL7 Message MLLP Consumers only

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.idle-timeout
properties.description: The approximate idle time allowed before the Client TCP Connection will be reset. A null value or a value less than or equal to zero will disable the idle timeout.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.idle-timeout-strategy
properties.description: decide what action to take when idle timeout occurs. Possible values are : RESET: set SO_LINGER to 0 and reset the socket CLOSE: close the socket gracefully default is RESET.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.keep-alive
properties.description: Enable/disable the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.lenient-bind
properties.description: TCP Server Only - Allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound. In some environments, it may be desirable to allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.log-phi
properties.description: Whether to log PHI

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.log-phi-max-bytes
properties.description: Set the maximum number of bytes of PHI that will be logged in a log entry.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.max-concurrent-consumers
properties.description: The maximum number of concurrent MLLP Consumer connections that will be allowed. If a new connection is received and the maximum is number are already established, the new connection will be reset immediately.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.read-timeout
properties.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used after the start of an MLLP frame has been received

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.receive-buffer-size
properties.description: Sets the SO_RCVBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.receive-timeout
properties.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used when waiting for the start of an MLLP frame

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.require-end-of-data
properties.description: Enable/Disable strict compliance to the MLLP standard. The MLLP standard specifies START_OF_BLOCKhl7 payloadEND_OF_BLOCKEND_OF_DATA, however, some systems do not send the final END_OF_DATA byte. This setting controls whether or not the final END_OF_DATA byte is required or optional.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.reuse-address
properties.description: Enable/disable the SO_REUSEADDR socket option.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.send-buffer-size
properties.description: Sets the SO_SNDBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.string-payload
properties.description: Enable/Disable converting the payload to a String. If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated converted to a String. If the charsetName property is set, that character set will be used for the conversion. If the charsetName property is not set, the value of MSH-18 will be used to determine th appropriate character set. If MSH-18 is not set, then the default ISO-8859-1 character set will be use.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.tcp-no-delay
properties.description: Enable/disable the TCP_NODELAY socket option.

properties.name: camel.component.mllp.validate-payload
properties.description: Enable/Disable the validation of HL7 Payloads If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated (see Hl7Util.generateInvalidPayloadExceptionMessage for details on the validation). If and invalid payload is detected, a MllpInvalidMessageException (for consumers) or a MllpInvalidAcknowledgementException will be thrown.
